input_text:
Job Title: Warehouse Specialist

Location: Edwards, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Goldbelt Integrated Logistics Services (GbILS) provides four specific areas of expertise—Logistics Engineering, Measurement Sciences, Program Management, and Technical Support—serving the scientific, technical, and engineering needs of clients. GbILS values its innovative thinking and service-oriented team who provide services for a variety of federal government and commercial clients.

Summary:

The Warehouse Specialist will provide services and support to the NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center contract located at Edwards AFB, California. The Warehouse Specialist will perform duties primarily associated with SCA Labor Category Warehouse Specialist from the SCA Directory of Occupations 5th edition.

Responsibilities

Essential Job Functions:

 Be assigned to one or more work areas to support contract Logistics Services consisting of: Supply and Materials Management  Equipment Management  Property Disposal  Transportation Management (including shipping and fleet management) Mail Management  Perform duties found within the Performance Work Statement (PWS) section 4, Supply and Materials Management Operations and may support section 8, Mail Management in accordance with NASA Instructions and Technical Directives Perform industrial actions in support of supply management services in accordance with NPD 4100.1, Supply Support & Material Management Policy, NPR 4100.1, NASA Supply Support and Material Management and AFOP 4100.1 Stock (Store, Program & Standby) Issue & Turn-In Procedure  Perform warehousing operations for the Center require the use of two different systems: and any future approved NASA automated systems NASA SAP SMS for non-aircraft parts  NASA NAMIS for aircraft parts  Keep both systems up to date with information that accurately reflects all warehousing activities  May provide mail services (i.e., receipt, storage, and distribution) for the AFRC community to include United States Postal Service (USPS) mail, express/certified/registered/priority and small packages, AFRC internal mail, and pouch mail If trained and required to support mail duties, will be required to obtain and retain a Secret clearance  Utilize NASA provided computer equipment and software/databases to perform required job duties  Be familiar with NASA publications, forms, and regulations listed in the PWS and how all work activities are performed in accordance with those references  Verifying materials against receiving documents, noting and reporting discrepancies and obvious damages, routing materials to prescribed storage location(s)  Storing, stacking, or palletizing materials in accordance with prescribed storage methods, rearranging and taking inventory of stored materials, examining stored materials and reporting deterioration and damage, and removing material from storage and preparing it for shipment  May be tasked, trained, and perform duties as a non-CDL Truck Driver or Material Handling Equipment operator, including operating: Medium Trucks, Forklifts, and Specialty Material Handling Equipment  May make parts deliveries to customers using vehicles including golf carts, GEM carts, and light duty trucks 

Qualifications

Necessary Skills and Knowledge:

 Ability to safely lift to 50 lbs.  Must be able to pass NASA forklift training and certification and pass NASA physical to receive forklift license.  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and via email  Ability to perform the physical requirements of the position including being on your feet most of the day and lifting requirements.  Ability to be trained in the use of warehouse tools and manual material handling equipment. 

Minimum Qualifications:

 Ability to obtain and retain a Common Access Card (CAC).  Must be able to clearly read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.  Ability to pass a background check including a clean driving record.  Pass pre-employment drug screening. 

Preferred Qualifications:

 Previous experience in using computers as part of a military or civilian retail / store / warehouse environment.  Previous experience working in a warehouse or other industrial environment and/or experience with driving trucks and/or other non-CDL required vehicles.  High school diploma or equivalent 

The salary for this position is $19.77 per hour.

Pay And Benefits

At Goldbelt, we value and reward our team's dedication and hard work. We provide a competitive base salary commensurate with your qualifications and experience. As an employee, you'll enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with company matching, tax-deferred savings options, supplementary benefits, paid time off, and professional development opportunities.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
